caption.title: Error in estimating the probability of a major outbreak when asymptomatic individuals are tested for infection, when the incubation and latent periods are not identical.
caption.p:
The mean error in the probability of a major outbreak, as a function of the percentage of asymptomatic individuals tested and the probability that presymptomatic infection is correctly identified, is calculated from 10,000 simulations for each (percentage, p
d ) pair when: A. Symptoms appear before individuals become infectious; B. Symptoms appear after individuals become infectious.
Click here for additional data file.
